resources.string: Sit back and relax. It usually takes 5â€“10 minutes for an order to be processed! Our representative will soon be accepting your order.
Your order has been accepted by our representatives. Relax, till we are preparing your order and assign you one of our delivery agents.
Your order have been prepared with love and now its on the way to you! Hold your cravings till our delivery agent knock on your door!
Your order has been delivered successfully! Hope you enjoyed your meal. And if you did, We would appreciate if you consider reviewing our service from the app.

Hello, I am Aditya, the creator of Food Owl, a hyperlocal late night food delivery service that is yet to be launched. I also founded Project Macht (https://www.projectmacht.xyz). I am currently pursuing B.Tech in Computer Science at LNCT Bhopal. I am a Computer Science Enthusiast. I am skilled in Android Development and Machine Learning.

Food Owl was conceptualized in a hostel room, Bhopal by Aditya Asthana. The idea struck when Asthana, along with his mates found themselves hungry in the middle of a night 03:00 AM in the morning. The traditional FnB applications presented some late night restaurants open, but the final prices were sky rocket. This was the moment, when he realised, the need for late night food services in the community. Since then, it is a journey. We are here in our testing phase of the prototype.

We are a "Conceptualizing" Project, that deals in FnB Industry and specifically target late night food hunger and cravings. This application is currently in development and is available for testing purposes. The application has Payments enabled in testing mode and hence, no money will be deducted. We are living in 21st century where we witness different lifestyles. One of the trending lifestyle is the night lifestyle where creative minds are awake in the night being productive or maybe just chilling. But the experience is worsened when the hunger strikes! This gives birth to our concept of late night food delivery service, where we aim to stop the hunger from killing the creativity of our costumers.
